required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Observation of Coronary Arterial Microcirculation Dysfunction in Diabetic Patients With Non- Obstructive Coronary Artery Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the prevalence and degree of coronary arterial microcirculaiton dysfunction of non- obstructive coronary artery disease in patients with type 2 diabetes. Furthermore, the risk factors of coronary arterial microcirulation would be screened and identified.

primary_outcome.measure: The coronary microcirculation dysfunction is measured by index of microcirculatory resistance
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after diagnosis is made by CAG

arm_group.arm_group_label: Non- obstructive coronary artery disease, non- diabetic
arm_group.description: Clinical evidences such as Holter, Treadmill exercise test and cardiac ECT support myocardial ischemia. CAG showed 20%-70% arterial stenosis. Patients are diagnosed without diabetes.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Non- obstructive coronary artery disease, diabetic
arm_group.description: Clinical evidences such as Holter, Treadmill exercise test and cardiac ECT support myocardial ischemia. CAG showed 20%-70% arterial stenosis. Patients are diagnosed with type 2 diabetes.
